name: Html.A11y
comment: @docs Input, textInput, radioInput, checkboxInput, leftLabeledInput, rightLabeledInput, invisibleLabeledInput

aliases.name: Input
aliases.comment:
{ label : Html msg
    , typeAndValue : InputTypeAndValue
    , attributes : List (Html.Attribute msg)
    }
aliases.type: { label : Html.Html msg , typeAndValue : Html.A11y.InputTypeAndValue , attributes : List (Html.Attribute msg) }

values.name: checkboxInput
values.comment:
This will construct a checkbox input. THe first argument is the value of the checkbox.
The second is whether the radio is checked, unchecked, or indeterminate.
    checkboxInput "radio_name" "This is the actual value of the radio." True

values.name: invisibleLabeledInput
values.comment:
Produces a labeled input of a given label type.
This label is visibly hidden, but is still available for screen readers.
E.g., use this input if your design asks that you convey information via placeholders
rather than visible labels.
Requires that you pass an id.

values.name: leftLabeledInput
values.comment: Produces a labeled input of a given label type. The label appears on the left side on the input.

values.name: radioInput
values.comment:
This will construct a radio input. The first argument is the radio group name
in common across radio items. THe second argument is the value of the radio.
The third is whether the radio is checked or not.
    radioInput "radio_name" "This is the actual value of the radio." True

values.name: rightLabeledInput
values.comment: Produces a labeled input of a given label type. The label appears on the right side on the input.

values.name: textInput
values.comment:
This will construct a text input with the value passed in.
    textInput "This appears in the text input."

name: Html.Attributes.A11y
comment:
@docs invisible

For more information on hiding/semi-hiding elements, please see [the a11y project.](http://a11yproject.com/posts/how-to-hide-content/)

values.name: invisible
values.comment:
Makes content invisible without making it inaccessible.
    label [ invisible ] [ text "Screen readers can still read me!" ]
